sentences.en: Actually what he said did me quite a disservice.
sentences.cn: 他这么说其实是在给我帮倒忙.

sentences.en: He said the protesters were doing a disservice to the nation.
sentences.cn: 他表示，抗议者们的行为正对国家造成危害。

sentences.en: In this it has done mankind a great disservice.
sentences.cn: 这种做法对人类危害非浅.

sentences.en: Life always someone for you disservice this time, you do not have to blame someone else.
sentences.cn: 生活中总有人会为你帮倒忙,这时, 你不用去责怪别人.

sentences.en: Miss Crawford's beauty did her no disservice with the Miss Bertrams.
sentences.cn: 克劳福特小姐的美貌并未引起两位贝特伦小姐不快.

sentences.en: She did her cause great disservice by concealing the truth.
sentences.cn: 她隐瞒了真相,这对她所参与的事业极为不利.

sentences.en: The adless publication is painted either as a disservice to the public, or an economic impossibility.
sentences.cn: 无广告的出版物被说成是对公众不利的, 或者说在经济上是不可能的.

sentences.en: This a disservice to ISKCON and its leaders.
sentences.cn: 这是我对ISKCON及协会中的其他领导所造成的损害.

sentences.en: This is where our pain - avoidance mechanisms do us a disservice, especially as traders.
sentences.cn: 这是痛苦回避系统对我们的伤害, 对交易者更是如此.

sentences.en: We will never do any disservice to you [ anything to hurt you ].
sentences.cn: 我们决不会做任何对不起你们的事情.

sentences.en: When we are not careful enough they will do disservice to us.
sentences.cn: 文中介绍的毒物包括了常见的家居或在身边随处可见的植物,对我们来说普通但实际上不平常.

sentences.en: You could do yourself a grave disservice by revealing all to a potential rival.
sentences.cn: 将一切都透露给潜在的竞争对手只会给自己帮倒忙。

words.tran_cn: 伤害；帮倒忙的行为；不亲切的行为；虐待

trans.tran_cn: 伤害，虐待，不亲切的行为
trans.tran_en: If you do someone or something a disservice, you harm them in some way
